meanings.definition: The position or authority of a king.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, kingships were highly respected and held great power.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the crown symbolized the kingships of the ruler.
meanings.sent3: The kingships of the monarch were challenged by a mischievous jester.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style reflected the kingships of a wise ruler.
meanings.sent5: Legends of old often spoke of the majestic kingships of legendary kings.

meanings.definition: The period during which a king rules.
meanings.sent1: The kingships of Queen Elizabeth II have spanned many decades.
meanings.sent2: History books document the kingships of rulers from different eras.
meanings.sent3: During the kingships of the king, the kingdom prospered and flourished.
meanings.sent4: The kingships of the past were filled with tales of bravery and valor.
meanings.sent5: The kingships of ancient dynasties were marked by grand ceremonies and feasts.

meanings.definition: The relationship or status of being a king.
meanings.sent1: The kingships between neighboring kingdoms were sometimes strained.
meanings.sent2: The young prince eagerly awaited the day he would assume the kingships.
meanings.sent3: The kingships of the royal family were a topic of gossip among the courtiers.
meanings.sent4: His demeanor exuded the confidence that came with kingships.
meanings.sent5: The kingships of the ruler were evident in the way he carried himself with authority.
